sponsor.partnerMessage: Bowen Dental Studio is a dental office unlike anything you've experienced. Our patients receive personalized, compassionate care from one of the most highly-skilled dentists in the area. We prioritize listening to and caring for our patients to build long-term relationships with them and help them reach their dental goals. Learn more here.

posts.title: Weekend Roundup
posts.content:
The weekend is back, and so are some staples of the region. If you've been looking for a fun way to unwind over the next couple days, look no further.

  • More to the market: Local farmer's markets are always a favorite. Visit any downtown, and you're in for an experience.
  • K9 and wine: Bring your family and 4 legged friend to Sassafras Vineyard this weekend for Dog Days of Summer.
  • Music Fest: Chamber Music Fest continues through Saturday with plenty of other live music options as well.
  • Outdoor film series: CBMAA is inviting people over to watch The Goonies outside tonight.
  • Bark at the ball park: Sunday, the NWA Naturals invite you and your furry friends to the ball park.
  • Tour de Frida: An art tour on bikes presented by Latinas Bikes is taking place tomorrow in Fayetteville.
  • Hip Hop Cares: An event with 100% going to charity, local artists showoff their music for a good cause.
  • Weekend of vaccines: Still need your first or second shot - find a location convenient to you.

Enjoy the weekend, and we'll catch you right back here on Monday!

posts.title: Cool Jobs in NWA
posts.content:
On the job hunt? Check out these new jobs posted to our community board this week:

  • Jones Center in Springdale is seeking a Fitness Manager.
  • Peel Compton Foundation is looking to fill an Development Coordinator role.
  • City of Fayetteville is in search of a new Director of Parks.

Have a job you're looking to fill? Post it here for FREE, and we might feature it next week!

posts.title: Let's Get Together
posts.content:
Bella Vista's natural beauty, rapidly expanding trail system, and lakes make it an oasis for those that love the outdoors. This natural beauty makes Bella Vista a great place to host special events.

  • The spot: Overlooking Loch Lomond with a great vantage point for sunset, Lakepoint is a picturesque location for weddings, holiday parties, and corporate events.
  • Jack of all trades: In addition to a great view, Lakepoint has the all resources to make your event great: a restaurant, a tasting room, a pergola overlooking the lake, and even an event planner.

Check out all Lakepoint has to offer HERE.

posts.title: Growing Like Crazy
posts.content:
Cities across the country are bouncing back from the pandemic with force, and Business Facilities just released several rankings for cities growing the fastest.

  • Keeping with tradition: NWA has a long history of local food production going global. These companies have provided the foundation for the NWA area to reach No. 2 on this year's Food Processing rankings.
  • Up and Coming: Additionally, the NWA region has been ranked No. 4 on the list of Fastest-Growing Metro areas. With a thriving real estate market and diverse listing of job opportunities, the region continues to catch eyes.

Read more about the rankings and methods used HERE.

posts.title: Back For More
posts.content:
The Razorbacks just signed a major deal with head coach Dave Van Horn that should keep him around for another ten years.

  • A regular powerhouse: Coach Van Horn has been at the U of A for 19 seasons, helping the Razorbacks win over 750 of their games and consistently rank in the national top 25. With his track record, fans can rest easy knowing Arkansas will remain in good hands.
  • On the money: Numbers were good on and off the field. After turning a profit last season, Razorbacks baseball happily offered Coach Van Horn an annual $1.25mm contract to keep up the winning work.

Learn more about the Razorbacks baseball success HERE.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• Going golden: Arkansas basketball player Moses Moody has been drafted by the Golden State Warriors.
  • Building bridges: Crystal Bridges is hosting Camp Connect to help children with autism connect with other kids.
  • A few more pages: Over 100 new Arkansas laws were passed on Wednesday.
  • Can you dig it? Fayetteville wants to help its residents get in on their new food-waste program with an event next week.
  • Sharp shooting: Arkansas native Kayle Browning won the silver medal for trap shooting after "an amazing comeback."
  • Collaboration talk: We want to feature your local business - check out our advertising packages.
